Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Description: Petrobras, a Brazilian state-owned and state-controlled energy company, entered into an agreement with U.S. and Brazilian authorities to pay $853.2 million in penalties to resolve the U.S. government's investigation into violations of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act  relating to payments to politicians and political parties in Brazil. The Justice Department and the Securities and Exchange Commission were to receive 20 percent of the total, with the rest going to Brazilian authorities.

Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Info Source: Extracted from a download of the EPA's Enforcement and Compliance History Online (ECHO) ICIS FE&C file downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at http://echo.epa.gov/tools/data-downloads#downloads
